title: ARPANET Goes Live
overview: The ARPANET project connects UCLA, Stanford Research Institute, UC Santa Barbara, and University of Utah — the foundation of packet-switched networking.

title: Ethernet Developed at Xerox PARC
overview: Bob Metcalfe and David Boggs design Ethernet at Xerox PARC, creating the blueprint for the most widely adopted LAN technology.

title: IEEE 802.3 — 10 Mb/s Ethernet
overview: The IEEE 802.3 standard for Ethernet at 10 megabits per second is ratified, providing the baseline for LAN networking.

title: Spanning Tree Protocol (STP)
overview: Radia Perlman designs the Spanning Tree Protocol to prevent loops in Ethernet networks, enabling reliable switching topologies.

title: CIDR Introduced
overview: Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) deployed to reduce routing table growth and enable more efficient address allocation.

title: Network Address Translation (NAT)
overview: NAT gains popularity as a way to extend the life of IPv4, allowing private networks to share a single public IP.

title: MPLS Standardized
overview: Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) is introduced, enabling faster, more efficient routing and VPNs across backbone networks.

title: IPv6 Tunneling Mechanisms
overview: Transition technologies like 6to4, Teredo, and ISATAP are widely deployed, allowing IPv6 traffic to traverse IPv4 infrastructure.

title: SD-WAN Emerges
overview: Software-defined WAN technologies gain traction, enabling enterprises to optimize connectivity across multiple ISPs and clouds.

title: 5G Backhaul Strains Networks
overview: The rise of 5G mobile deployments accelerates demand for dense fiber backhaul, redefining ISP networking requirements.
